title: French rape trial must 'change relations between men and women': Prosecutor
content: In a chilling Avignon courtroom, a French prosecutor declared a rape trial involving 51 men a turning point in gender relations. The men, aged 26 to 74, allegedly participated in the repeated rape of a woman, orchestrated by her ex-husband.
summary: In a chilling Avignon courtroom, a French prosecutor declared a rape trial involving 51 men a turning point in gender relations. The men, aged 26 to 74, allegedly participated in the repeated rape of a woman, orchestrated by her ex-husband.

title: 'That's not enough': Iran's Khamenei calls for death sentence for Israel's Netanyahu and Gallant
content: Iran's Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, called for death sentences against Israeli leaders following the International Criminal Court's issuance of arrest warrants for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, his former defence chief, and Hamas leader Ibrahim Al-Masri. The ICC cited alleged war crimes in Gaza, a charge Israel vehemently denies. Khamenei deemed arrest warrants insufficient, demanding capital punishment.
summary: Iran's Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, called for death sentences against Israeli leaders following the International Criminal Court's issuance of arrest warrants for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, his former defence chief, and Hamas leader Ibrahim Al-Masri. The ICC cited alleged war crimes in Gaza, a charge Israel vehemently denies. Khamenei deemed arrest warrants insufficient, demanding capital punishment.

title: An average of 140 women and girls were killed by a partner or relative per day in 2023, UN says
content: A new UN report reveals that approximately 140 women and girls were killed daily by partners or family members in 2023, totaling around 51,100 victims globally. The home remains the most dangerous place for women, with Africa experiencing the highest number of such killings.
summary: A new UN report reveals that approximately 140 women and girls were killed daily by partners or family members in 2023, totaling around 51,100 victims globally.  The home remains the most dangerous place for women, with Africa experiencing the highest number of such killings.

title: Watch: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan's supporters protest in over 60 locations worldwide
content: Supporters of former Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan staged protests in over 60 locations globally, demanding his release following his arrest. The Pakistani government, labeling the protests a "well-thought-out conspiracy," detained over 1,200 PTI workers and implemented internet restrictions to curb the demonstrations.
summary: Supporters of former Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan staged protests in over 60 locations globally, demanding his release following his arrest. The Pakistani government, labeling the protests a "well-thought-out conspiracy," detained over 1,200 PTI workers and implemented internet restrictions to curb the demonstrations.

title: Dubai chocolate a global frenzy: Germans smuggle and queue up for hours in cold for these luxury Lindt bars
content: Pistachio-filled chocolate bars, inspired by a viral Dubai creation, are captivating Germany. Berlin baker Ali Fakhro's rendition, featuring kataifi for added crunch, is flying off the shelves. Limited-edition bars are commanding exorbitant prices, with some enduring long queues and even resorting to smuggling. The craze extends beyond personal consumption, as individuals eye lucrative resale opportunities.
summary: Pistachio-filled chocolate bars, inspired by a viral Dubai creation, are captivating Germany.  Berlin baker Ali Fakhro's rendition, featuring kataifi for added crunch, is flying off the shelves.  Limited-edition bars are commanding exorbitant prices, with some enduring long queues and even resorting to smuggling.  The craze extends beyond personal consumption, as individuals eye lucrative resale opportunities.

title: In world's largest refugee camps, Rohingya mobilise to fight in Myanmar
content: Thousands of Rohingya refugees in Bangladesh are joining the civil war in Myanmar, seeking to reclaim their homeland. These insurgents, some forcibly recruited, are aligning with the Myanmar military against the Arakan Army. The situation is causing escalating violence and fear within the refugee camps, raising concerns about the future of the Rohingya people.
summary: Thousands of Rohingya refugees in Bangladesh are joining the civil war in Myanmar, seeking to reclaim their homeland.  These insurgents, some forcibly recruited, are aligning with the Myanmar military against the Arakan Army.  The situation is causing escalating violence and fear within the refugee camps, raising concerns about the future of the Rohingya people.

title: Left-wing candidate Orsi wins Uruguay presidential election
content: Left-wing politician Yamandu Orsi was elected president of Uruguay, official results showed on Sunday, in a rebuke by voters of five years of conservative rule. - 'A very different world' - The victory for Orsi will see Uruguay swing left again after five years of center-right rule in the country of 3.4 million inhabitants.
summary: Left-wing politician Yamandu Orsi was elected president of Uruguay, official results showed on Sunday, in a rebuke by voters of five years of conservative rule. - 'A very different world' - The victory for Orsi will see Uruguay swing left again after five years of center-right rule in the country of 3.4 million inhabitants.

title: Multi-storey residential building collapses in Beirut, 29 dead
content: Israeli airstrikes in Lebanon have killed at least 29 people in Beirut and many more across the country. The strikes targeted Hezbollah infrastructure and command centers, significantly escalating Israel's ongoing military campaign against the group despite ceasefire negotiations.
summary: Israeli airstrikes in Lebanon have killed at least 29 people in Beirut and many more across the country. The strikes targeted Hezbollah infrastructure and command centers, significantly escalating Israel's ongoing military campaign against the group despite ceasefire negotiations.

title: Winter storms to bring rain, snow, and disruptions during Thanksgiving week across US
content: The US braces for another round of winter weather during Thanksgiving week, with heavy snow expected in the Sierra Nevada and rain across the Midwest and East Coast. While California grapples with flood damage and power outages from a recent "bomb cyclone," the upcoming system is not expected to be as severe. However, travelers are advised to prepare for wet conditions.
summary: The US braces for another round of winter weather during Thanksgiving week, with heavy snow expected in the Sierra Nevada and rain across the Midwest and East Coast. While California grapples with flood damage and power outages from a recent "bomb cyclone," the upcoming system is not expected to be as severe. However, travelers are advised to prepare for wet conditions.

title: Man charged with town's first 'stranger rape' in over 12 years in Virginia
content: A Virginia hiking trail became the scene of a shocking assault when a Honduran man, recently released from jail for indecent exposure, allegedly raped a woman. Denis Romero, who was in the US illegally, is accused of grabbing the victim, forcing her down, and assaulting her.
summary: A Virginia hiking trail became the scene of a shocking assault when a Honduran man, recently released from jail for indecent exposure, allegedly raped a woman. Denis Romero, who was in the US illegally, is accused of grabbing the victim, forcing her down, and assaulting her.

title: Watch: Terrified passengers flee as Russian jetliner catches fire on Antalya Airport runway
content: An Azimuth Airlines flight from Sochi to Antalya experienced a fiery landing on Sunday, prompting the evacuation of all 89 passengers and six crew members. Videos captured the terrifying scene as passengers escaped the burning aircraft via emergency slides. Thankfully, no injuries were reported. Authorities suspect wind shear caused the rough landing, sparking the engine fire. An investigation is underway.
summary: An Azimuth Airlines flight from Sochi to Antalya experienced a fiery landing on Sunday, prompting the evacuation of all 89 passengers and six crew members. Videos captured the terrifying scene as passengers escaped the burning aircraft via emergency slides. Thankfully, no injuries were reported. Authorities suspect wind shear caused the rough landing, sparking the engine fire. An investigation is underway.

title: Army veteran who lost both legs in war calls out Pete Hegseth's views on women in combat: 'Unqualified for...'
content: US Senator Tammy Duckworth criticized Pete Hegseth, Trump's nominee for Defense Secretary, for his views on women in combat. Duckworth, a combat veteran who lost both legs in Iraq, highlighted Hegseth's lack of command experience and argued that excluding women would worsen military recruitment issues.
summary: US Senator Tammy Duckworth criticized Pete Hegseth, Trump's nominee for Defense Secretary, for his views on women in combat. Duckworth, a combat veteran who lost both legs in Iraq, highlighted Hegseth's lack of command experience and argued that excluding women would worsen military recruitment issues.

title: Adani US indictment: Bangladesh panel for power pacts' review, including Adani group's
120th Toronto Santa Claus parade: Know route, timings, and activities of iconic event
content: Toronto's beloved Santa Claus Parade returns for its 120th year this Sunday, with a record-breaking 750,000 spectators expected to line the streets. The festive spectacle, featuring 27 handcrafted floats and over 2,000 participants, will wind its way through a slightly altered route due to construction.
summary: Toronto's beloved Santa Claus Parade returns for its 120th year this Sunday, with a record-breaking 750,000 spectators expected to line the streets. The festive spectacle, featuring 27 handcrafted floats and over 2,000 participants, will wind its way through a slightly altered route due to construction.

title: Colorado Civil Air Patrol plane crash kills pilot and photographer, one injured
content: A Civil Air Patrol training mission in Larimer County, Colorado, ended tragically on Saturday when the plane crashed, killing pilot Susan Wolber and aerial photographer Jay Rhoten. Co-pilot Randall Settergren survived with injuries. Colorado officials expressed condolences and praised the victims' dedication to public service.
summary: A Civil Air Patrol training mission in Larimer County, Colorado, ended tragically on Saturday when the plane crashed, killing pilot Susan Wolber and aerial photographer Jay Rhoten. Co-pilot Randall Settergren survived with injuries. Colorado officials expressed condolences and praised the victims' dedication to public service.

title: American Airlines introduces new boarding technology to stop line-cutting at gate
content: American Airlines is tackling airport line-cutting with new boarding technology. The software, now in over 100 US airports, prevents passengers from scanning their boarding passes before their assigned group is called. This initiative aims to reduce chaos and potential conflicts during boarding, especially during the busy Thanksgiving travel season.
summary: American Airlines is tackling airport line-cutting with new boarding technology. The software, now in over 100 US airports, prevents passengers from scanning their boarding passes before their assigned group is called. This initiative aims to reduce chaos and potential conflicts during boarding, especially during the busy Thanksgiving travel season.

title: GOP Senator Markwayne Mullin blocks General promotion to give Trump time to weigh in: Reports
content: Senator Markwayne Mullin, a staunch supporter of Donald Trump, has stalled the promotion of Lt. Gen. Christopher Donahue, the final U.S. soldier to leave Afghanistan. Mullin's action aims to allow the incoming Trump administration to review the promotion. This delay impacts nearly 1,000 military promotions.
summary: Senator Markwayne Mullin, a staunch supporter of Donald Trump, has stalled the promotion of Lt. Gen. Christopher Donahue, the final U.S. soldier to leave Afghanistan. Mullin's action aims to allow the incoming Trump administration to review the promotion. This delay impacts nearly 1,000 military promotions.

title: Protests by ex-PM Imran Khan's party cost Pakistan's economy PKR 2 billion
content: Imran Khan's PTI party protests in Pakistan have cost the government over PKR 2 billion over the past 18 months, according to Geo News. Damages to public and private property, security expenses, and lost productivity have added to the financial strain on the struggling economy.
summary: Imran Khan's PTI party protests in Pakistan have cost the government over PKR 2 billion over the past 18 months, according to Geo News. Damages to public and private property, security expenses, and lost productivity have added to the financial strain on the struggling economy.

title: US couple arrested for stealing nearly $1 million worth of Lululemon apparel across multiple states
content: A Connecticut couple, Jadion and Akwele Richards, were apprehended for allegedly stealing nearly $1 million worth of Lululemon apparel over two months. The thefts spanned multiple states, with the couple employing tactics like distracting employees to conceal clothing. Lululemon investigators noticed the pattern and alerted authorities, leading to their arrest with stolen goods in their possession.
summary: A Connecticut couple, Jadion and Akwele Richards, were apprehended for allegedly stealing nearly $1 million worth of Lululemon apparel over two months. The thefts spanned multiple states, with the couple employing tactics like distracting employees to conceal clothing. Lululemon investigators noticed the pattern and alerted authorities, leading to their arrest with stolen goods in their possession.

title: 'Sebastian Gorka is a con man': John Bolton calls out Trump's pick for counterterrorism director
content: John Bolton has publicly criticized Sebastian Gorka, President-elect's pick for leading counterterrorism efforts, calling him a "con man." Bolton expressed his lack of confidence in Gorka's ability to handle the position and questioned his credentials, suggesting an FBI investigation into his background.
summary: John Bolton has publicly criticized Sebastian Gorka, President-elect's pick for leading counterterrorism efforts, calling him a "con man." Bolton expressed his lack of confidence in Gorka's ability to handle the position and questioned his credentials, suggesting an FBI investigation into his background.
